intro: Megalastrum grande, commonly known as the giant starflower, is a striking member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant features a woody stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period typically occurs in the summer months, attracting a variety of pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be challenging to grow outside its native habitat.
